programme.title: INEOS vs Luna Rossa race for a spot in the final
programme.desc: Luna Rossa Prada Pirelli attempts a comeback after an incident for a spot in the 37th America's Cup final.

programme.title: The first-ever Women's America's Cup
programme.desc: For the first time, female sailors compete in their own category for the Women's America's Cup.

programme.title: Kicking off in Barcelona
programme.desc: The world's oldest global sports competition still running kicks off in Barcelona for the 37th America’s Cup.

programme.title: Crowning the 37th America's Cup winner
programme.desc: The 37th America’s Cup finale unfolds as INEOS Britannia and Emirates Team New Zealand sail for the crown.

programme.title: This is Beth
programme.desc: An intimate look beneath the success of legendary climber Beth Rodden, diving into her struggles and transformation.

programme.title: Bridge boys
programme.desc: Tom Randall and Pete Whittaker take on the most absurd crack climb when they end up under a motorway bridge.

programme.title: Flex
programme.desc: Matty Hong and Margo Hayes challenge themselves by ascending two of the hardest climbs in Colorado, USA.

programme.title: Smile and fight
programme.desc: Can big wall climber Natalia Grossman handle the pressure of defending her IFSC World Cup Champion title?

programme.title: Greece
programme.desc: Sasha DiGiulian creates new routes in a Grecian area not typically travelled to by the climbing community.

programme.title: Dominican Republic
programme.desc: Sasha explores the climbing scene in the Dominican Republic and connects with local athletes.

programme.title: Malibu, USA
programme.desc: Sasha learns from other elite athletes in Malibu, California, as she trains for her next big wall challenge.

programme.title: Maine, USA
programme.desc: Sasha navigates Maine’s climbing landscape and learns more about humanity’s impact on the environment.

programme.title: Hood River, USA
programme.desc: Sasha teaches climbing basics and tries her hand at kiteboarding in Hood River, Oregon.

programme.title: Momentum: Angie Scarth-Johnson
programme.desc: Spend a year touring the world with Australia’s Angie Scarth-Johnson as she pushes the boundaries of climbing.

programme.title: A line across the sky part 2
programme.desc: The two most capable rock climbers in the world continue their trek across the Fitz Roy Traverse in Patagonia.

programme.title: Showdown at Horseshoe Hell
programme.desc: Part competition and part rock festival, the 24 Hours of Horseshoe Hell is climbing's craziest competition.

programme.title: High and mighty part 1
programme.desc: Highball bouldering fuses difficult moves and dire consequences. But for the sport's elite, that's the draw.

programme.title: High and mighty part 2
programme.desc: One of the strongest climbers on earth must overcome his fear of heights in order to make bouldering history.

programme.title: Lowe Point
programme.desc: Mountaineering legend Jeff Lowe reflects on the two climbs that forever changed the course of his life.

programme.title: Redemption
programme.desc: Follow a British climber's fall from grace to humiliation and his story of climbing towards redemption.

programme.title: Operation Moffat
programme.desc: Claire Carter is a climber and writer. Here she follows in the footsteps of her groundbreaking idol.

programme.title: Return of the Lords
programme.desc: Follow the electrifying 2024 event as the world's best breaking crews battled it out in Seattle, USA.

programme.title: Highlights – Riyadh Premier Padel P1
programme.desc: Enjoy highlights of the first Premier Padel stop of the season in Saudi Arabia's capital, the Riyadh Season P1.

programme.title: Highlights – Acapulco Premier Padel P1
programme.desc: Watch the highlights of the third stop of the season in Mexico for the Acapulco Premier Padel P1.

programme.title: Highlights – Brussels Premier Padel P2
programme.desc: Watch the highlights of the fifth stop of the season in Belgium for the Brussels Premier Padel P2.
